Neutrophils comprise over half of the White Blood Cells in the blood.

B CELL: Also known as Antibody-producing Cell.
A type of Lymphocyte that fights antigens, such as bacteria and viruses by producing weapons called antibodies.

such as bacteria and viruses by producing weapons called antibodies.

- He annihilated them all in one shot!

summon a heavy rainfall and sweep everything away!

MAST CELL: Also known as Fat Cell.

STEROIDS: Also known as Adrenocortical Hormone.
A drug with powerful anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive effects.
Suppresses symptoms caused by histamines, as well as allergic reactions themselves.
